verification.payload:
tree 998495e7d8e372e34f6145f32ed18d0a45255fbb
parent 32b191fb66e644c690c94cbfdae6ddbc754769d7
author coinforensics <59567284+coinforensics@users.noreply.github.com> 1611337005 +0100
committer coinforensics <59567284+coinforensics@users.noreply.github.com> 1611337005 +0100

gitian-keys: add CoinForensics key

events.body:
ACK 94271d2ce7eaf8f625b3c8009b0c689bfdd73999

This key matches the key used to gitian-sign 0.21.0 and 0.21.0rc5 as CoinForensics. A different key seems to have been used for 0.21.0rc3 and 4.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #20958 (gitian-keys: Add signer aliases, some historical keys by laanwj)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: gitian-keys: Add signer aliases, some historical keys
issue.body:
Update `keys.txt` for `gitian-verify.py`  (bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools#71)

- Extend line format with signer aliases in parentheses
- Add a few historical signers
- Sort the file by name

Co-authored-by: fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com>

events.body:
@laanwj 
I setup a dedicated signing key after 0.21.0rc4.
